wikipedia_page.main: Lord John Edward FitzRoy (24 September 1785 – 28 December 1856), was a British politician.

response: *Lord John FitzRoy (1785–1856), Whig MP for Thetford (1812–1818) and Bury St Edmunds (1820–1826)

Fitzroy was still on active service in Aeolus when he was elected as Member of Parliament for the family seat of Thetford in the 1806 election, and so did not make first appearance in the house until 1810, as a supporter of the Whigs. He was replaced as MP by his brother Lord John FitzRoy at the 1812 election.

response: 9. Lord John FitzRoy – Whig MP for 12 years

Sir Thomas Astley Woollaston White, 5th Baronet
response: Sir Thomas and his family lived on the Torhousemuir Estate, near Wigtown in Dumfries and Galloway. His father bought the estate in 1944 from Lord John FitzRoy.
